snippet: The United Nations, citing wars in Syria, Iraq, Yemen and South Sudan as the major drivers of humanitarian needs, asked governments for more money than ever before.
abstract: United Nations asks governments for over $20 billion in 2016, its largest humanitarian aid funding request ever, to counter effects of wars which have created greatest refugee crisis since World War II.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations, citing wars in Syria, Iraq, Yemen and South Sudan as the major drivers of humanitarian needs, asked governments for more money than ever before.
